item.title: Commission grants USC control of Coliseum
item.dc:creator: gosorio
item.description: Following eight months of negotiations, USC has obtained day-to-day control of the Los Angeles Memorial Coliseum.

item.title: USC Trustee Kenneth Leventhal dies at 90
item.dc:creator: gosorio
item.category: elaine and kenneth leventhal school of accounting
ernst & young kenneth leventhal real estate group
item.description: Kenneth Leventhal, a USC life trustee and namesake of the USC Elaine and Kenneth Leventhal School of Accounting, died Tuesday morning in Los Angeles. He was 90. Though Leventhal graduated with a bachelor of science in business administration and accounting from UCLA, he dedicated much of his professional life to USC. After becoming a certified [...]

item.title: Trojans stumble in NCAA championship game against UC Irvine
item.dc:creator: gosorio
item.description: No. 1 UC Irvine upended the No. 2 USC men’s volleyball team in straight sets to win the NCAA championship Saturday with scores of 25-22, 34-32 and 26-24, marking the second national title in four years for the Anteaters. An announced crowd of 9,162 made its way to the Galen Center — the third-highest in NCAA [...]

item.title: Trojans punch ticket to NCAA title game with four-set win
item.dc:creator: gosorio
item.description: The USC men’s volleyball team earned a spot in the NCAA championship match against UC Irvine after beating Lewis University on Thursday at the Galen Center in four sets with scores of 25-18, 25-12, 18-25 and 27-25. Senior outside hitter Tony Ciarelli, recently crowned American Volleyball Coaches Association National Player of the Year, had a match-high 18 kills [...]

item.title: Steve A. Kay to be new dean of USC Dornsife
item.dc:creator: gosorio
item.description: Steve A. Kay, a biology professor from UC San Diego, was appointed the 21st Dean of the Dornsife College of Letters, Arts and Sciences on Tuesday. Kay will also hold the Anna H. Bing Dean’s Chair. The selection was announced in a letter sent electronically to Dornsife faculty, staff, students, alumni and supporters. The letter [...]

item.title: No. 4 Women of Troy prepare for Pac-12 Championship
item.dc:creator: cstepney
item.description: Coming off of a monumental win against No. 1 UCLA, the No. 4 USC women’s tennis team defend their regular season Pac-12 title this weekend in Ojai, Calif. for the Pac-12 Championship. “If we do well this weekend it’s great, but if we falter it’s not a huge deal,” USC coach Richard Gallien said. “It [...]

item.title: Young local business owner Caine Monroy shares story with Marshall class
item.dc:creator: cstepney
item.description: With these words, professor David Belasco of the Lloyd Greif Center for Entrepreneurial Studies introduced Caine Monroy, the youngest speaker the center has ever hosted for his Wednesday night class, Entrepreneurial Mindset: Taking the Leap. Nine-year-old Monroy stars in a video by filmmaker Nirvan Mullick that features his homemade cardboard box arcade in the auto parts and salvage yard owned [...]

item.title: LAPD, DPS officers to be added to USC area
item.dc:creator: cstepney
item.description: Numerous measures will be added to secure public safety in and around the university, including additional Los Angeles Police Department officers, technology and education. At a press conference in Town & Gown on Thursday, President C.L. Max Nikias, LAPD Chief Charlie Beck and Los Angeles Mayor Antonio Villaraigosa addressed safety of students and southwest Los [...]

item.title: Classifieds – April 26

item.description: The Daily Trojan features Classified advertising in each day's edition. Here you can read, search, and even print out each day's edition of the Classifieds.

item.title: USC forever changed by LA riots
item.dc:creator: rpflores
item.description: Though few USC students took part in the riots, students helped with the cleanup.

item.title: University almost unhurt by the riots
item.dc:creator: rpflores
item.description: This article was originally published May 4, 1992, in a special edition of the Daily Trojan. The city will remember the 20th anniversary of the Los Angeles riots on April 29.  The university campus has suffered minimal damage from the riots of the past three days, University Security officials said Sunday.The efforts of all university [...]

item.description: Participants will learn techniques for procedures, such as minimally invasive surgery.

item.description: Clayton Dube helped communicate with the parents of Ying Wu and Ming Qu, two graduate students fatally shot this month.

item.title: Whiz kid
item.dc:creator: rpflores
item.description: Caine Monroy, a 9-year-old boy from East Los Angeles who built an arcade out of cardboard boxes, and Nirvan Mullick, a documentary filmmaker who made the video “Caine’s Arcade,” speak to students in Taking the Leap (BAEP 470). See full coverage of the event online.

item.title: Slow growth could be good for job seekers

item.description: The population of California is expected to slow down more than expected over the next 20 years.

item.title: Comics offer incentives to maintain readership
item.dc:creator: rpflores
item.description: It’s a strange time for comics. It’s a strange time for media. Newspapers and books are struggling with the digital market, while films and music are fighting piracy. It’s not that simple to say the Internet is killing traditional media; new forms of distribution and a rise of independent creators are forcing pillars of any [...]

item.description: Director Josh Whedon and cast members of The Avengers discuss villainy, writing and the creation of the summer superhero flick.

item.title: Haute Highlights

item.description: E-40 Thursday, April 26, at 9 p.m. Key Club Hollywood Seminal Bay Area rapper E-40 should be more than just the butt of jokes about how to “get stupid” and “ghostride the whip.” The prolific musician and entrepreneur has released 17 albums and earned critical acclaim for his signature flow. Perhaps it’s illustrative of E-40’s [...]

item.title: Trojans look to end skid at home against Beavers

item.title: July marks the best of Trojan athletics

item.description: Until we meet again, USC. Wednesday marked the last night of production of The Daily Trojan for the spring semester, which means the semester is coming to a close. We all know what that means for students: Finals. Summer vacation. Job-hunting. But for many USC students, alumni and fans, the end of the semester means [...]

item.title: The marijuana debate is just getting annoying

item.description: April was a big month for drugs. So why is marijuana legalization taking so long? April also saw leaders meet for the Summit of [...]

item.title: Festival de Cannes releases film lineup
item.dc:creator: mcaskey
item.description: The Festival de Cannes, one of the most prestigious film festivals in the world, recently released its lineup of films. The film festival will open on May 16 with a screening of Moonrise Kingdom, Wes Anderson’s first live action film since 2007. The film stars Bruce Willis, Edward Norton, Bill Murray, Frances McDormand, Tilda Swinton [...]

item.title: Trojan spirit
item.dc:creator: rpflores
item.description: The USC Silks of the Trojan Marching Band teach students the routine for “Tusk” in front of Heritage Hall on Tuesday. Students without colorguard experience had the opportunity to learn moves such as dropspins, backscratchers, happy feet and slams.

item.title: USC revives the ‘student-athlete’

item.title: Rodney King riots still resonate with city
